questions.question: Ants love to eat …………………………
questions.description: A currant is a small berry used in buns.

questions.question: ……………………………. fashions are more casual than those of the 1960’s.
He gave the report a ……………………………… glance and tossed it aside.
questions.description: A cursory glance is a quick glance.

questions.question: The nation must put a …………………………. on its spending to balance the economy.
questions.description: As a noun curb means restraint or control.

questions.question: His loss didn’t …………………………….. his zest for living.
questions.description: As a verb damp can mean reduce, diminish or depress. Dampen means the same.

questions.question: With that …………………………… outlook he does not trust anyone.
questions.description: Cynical means scornful, derisive or sarcastic.

questions.question: The negotiations reached a …………………………. after two hours.
questions.description: All of these words mean the same.

questions.question: The boy’s directions ……………………….. us, and we never did find the lake.
questions.description: To mislead someone is to give them false information unintentionally or unknowingly.

questions.question: She ……………………………. her fiancé by dating others.
questions.description: To deceive someone is to give them a false impression either knowingly or intentionally.

questions.question: The magazine doesn’t accept any ……………………………. ads.
From her conversation, I …………………………. that she had a large family.
